news.title: Visa and Yellow Card Forge Stablecoin Path in Africa
news.body: Visa has partnered with Yellow Card to delve into stablecoin applications in Africa, aiming to enhance treasury operations and cross-border payments via Visa Direct. This collaboration could revolutionize financial transactions across the continent, offering more streamlined and efficient payment solutions.

news.title: Affirm and PGIM Boost Flexible Payment Options with $3B Facility
news.body: Affirm has broadened its capital partnership with PGIM Fixed Income, setting up a new $3 billion facility to purchase Affirm loans. This move is set to expand pay-over-time options, catering to a rising consumer demand for more flexible payment solutions and potentially reshaping consumer finance.

news.title: Illinois Postpones Interchange Fee Cap Until 2026
news.body: Illinois has delayed the implementation of a law capping interchange fees on tax and tip portions of card transactions to July 2026. This postponement allows businesses more time to adapt, significantly impacting financial strategies and operations across the state.

news.title: JPMorgan Enters Stablecoin Arena with JPMD Launch
news.body: JPMorgan has introduced its own stablecoin, JPMD, marking a significant move by a major bank into the digital currency space. This strategic launch highlights the growing relevance of stablecoins in the financial sector, potentially setting new standards for digital transactions.

news.title: Highnote and BVNK Partner for 24/7 Stablecoin Funding
news.body: Highnote has teamed up with BVNK to offer real-time, 24/7 stablecoin-based funding for card programs. This partnership represents a significant step in merging cryptocurrency solutions with traditional financial services, enhancing flexibility and accessibility in financial operations.
